briefdescription.para: Refer to the width of an integer register in bits(either 32 or 64)
CSR operation Macro for csrrw instruction.

detaileddescription.para:
Read the content of csr register to __v, then write content of val into csr register, then return __v
csr
CSR macro definition defined in Core CSR Registers, eg. CSR_MSTATUS
val
value to store into the CSR register
the CSR register value before written

briefdescription.para: CSR operation Macro for csrr instruction.

detaileddescription.para:
Read the content of csr register to __v and return it
csr
CSR macro definition defined in Core CSR Registers, eg. CSR_MSTATUS
the CSR register value

briefdescription.para: CSR operation Macro for csrw instruction.

detaileddescription.para:
Write the content of val to csr register
csr
CSR macro definition defined in Core CSR Registers, eg. CSR_MSTATUS
val
value to store into the CSR register

briefdescription.para: CSR operation Macro for csrrs instruction.

detaileddescription.para:
Read the content of csr register to __v, then set csr register to be __v | val, then return __v
csr
CSR macro definition defined in Core CSR Registers, eg. CSR_MSTATUS
val
Mask value to be used wih csrrs instruction
the CSR register value before written

briefdescription.para: CSR operation Macro for csrs instruction.

detaileddescription.para:
Set csr register to be csr_content | val
csr
CSR macro definition defined in Core CSR Registers, eg. CSR_MSTATUS
val
Mask value to be used wih csrs instruction

briefdescription.para: CSR operation Macro for csrrc instruction.

detaileddescription.para:
Read the content of csr register to __v, then set csr register to be __v & ~val, then return __v
csr
CSR macro definition defined in Core CSR Registers, eg. CSR_MSTATUS
val
Mask value to be used wih csrrc instruction
the CSR register value before written

briefdescription.para: CSR operation Macro for csrc instruction.

detaileddescription.para:
Set csr register to be csr_content & ~val
csr
CSR macro definition defined in Core CSR Registers, eg. CSR_MSTATUS
val
Mask value to be used wih csrc instruction

briefdescription.para: Execute fence instruction, p -> pred, s -> succ.

detaileddescription.para:
the FENCE instruction ensures that all memory accesses from instructions preceding the fence in program order (the predecessor set) appear earlier in the global memory order than memory accesses from instructions appearing after the fence in program order (the successor set). For details, please refer to The RISC-V Instruction Set Manual
p
predecessor set, such as iorw, rw, r, w
s
successor set, such as iorw, rw, r, w

briefdescription.para: Shallow sleep mode, the core_clk will poweroff.
Deep sleep mode, the core_clk and core_ano_clk will poweroff.
Type of Control and Status Register(CSR), depends on the XLEN defined in RISC-V.

detaileddescription.para:
Enables IRQ interrupts by setting the MIE-bit in the MSTATUS Register.
Can only be executed in Privileged modes.

Disables IRQ interrupts by clearing the MIE-bit in the MSTATUS Register.
Can only be executed in Privileged modes.

briefdescription.para: Read whole 64 bits value of mcycle counter.

detaileddescription.para:
This function will read the whole 64 bits of MCYCLE register
The whole 64 bits value of MCYCLE
It will work for both RV32 and RV64 to get full 64bits value of MCYCLE

briefdescription.para: Read whole 64 bits value of machine instruction-retired counter.

detaileddescription.para:
This function will read the whole 64 bits of MINSTRET register
The whole 64 bits value of MINSTRET
It will work for both RV32 and RV64 to get full 64bits value of MINSTRET

briefdescription.para: Read whole 64 bits value of real-time clock.

detaileddescription.para:
This function will read the whole 64 bits of TIME register
The whole 64 bits value of TIME CSR
It will work for both RV32 and RV64 to get full 64bits value of TIME
only available when user mode available
No Operation does nothing. This instruction can be used for code alignment purposes.

Wait For Interrupt is is executed using CSR_WFE.WFE=0 and WFI instruction. It will suspends execution until interrupt, NMI or Debug happened. When Core is waked up by interrupt, if
mstatus.MIE == 1(interrupt enabled), Core will enter ISR code
mstatus.MIE == 0(interrupt disabled), Core will resume previous execution
Wait For Event is executed using CSR_WFE.WFE=1 and WFI instruction. It will suspends execution until event, NMI or Debug happened. When Core is waked up, Core will resume previous execution
Causes the processor to enter Debug state. Debug tools can use this to investigate system state when the instruction at a particular address is reached.
The ECALL instruction is used to make a service request to the execution environment.

Set the SLEEPVALUE CSR register to control the WFI Sleep mode.
mode
The sleep mode to be set
Set the CSR TXEVT to control send a TX Event. The Core will output signal tx_evt as output event signal.
Clear the CY bit of MCOUNTINHIBIT to 0 to enable MCYCLE Counter
Set the CY bit of MCOUNTINHIBIT to 1 to disable MCYCLE Counter
Clear the IR bit of MCOUNTINHIBIT to 0 to enable MINSTRET Counter
Set the IR bit of MCOUNTINHIBIT to 1 to disable MINSTRET Counter
Clear the IR and CY bit of MCOUNTINHIBIT to 1 to enable MINSTRET & MCYCLE Counter
Set the IR and CY bit of MCOUNTINHIBIT to 1 to disable MINSTRET & MCYCLE Counter
The FENCE.I instruction is used to synchronize the instruction and data streams.

Load 8 bit value.
addr
Address pointer to data
value of type uint8_t at (*addr)

Load 16 bit value.
addr
Address pointer to data
value of type uint16_t at (*addr)

Load 32 bit value.
addr
Address pointer to data
value of type uint32_t at (*addr)

Write 8 bit value.
addr
Address pointer to data
val
Value to set

Write 16 bit value.
addr
Address pointer to data
val
Value to set

Write 32 bit value.
addr
Address pointer to data
val
Value to set

briefdescription.para: Compare and Swap 32bit value using LR and SC.

detaileddescription.para:
Compare old value with memory, if identical, store new value in memory. Return the initial value in memory. Success is indicated by comparing return value with OLD. memory address, return 0 if successful, otherwise return !0
addr
Address pointer to data, address need to be 4byte aligned
oldval
Old value of the data in address
newval
New value to be stored into the address
return the initial value in memory

Atomically swap new 32bit value into memory using amoswap.d.
addr
Address pointer to data, address need to be 4byte aligned
newval
New value to be stored into the address
return the original value in memory

Atomically ADD 32bit value with value in memory using amoadd.d.
addr
Address pointer to data, address need to be 4byte aligned
value
value to be ADDed
return memory value + add value

Atomically AND 32bit value with value in memory using amoand.d.
addr
Address pointer to data, address need to be 4byte aligned
value
value to be ANDed
return memory value & and value

Atomically OR 32bit value with value in memory using amoor.d.
addr
Address pointer to data, address need to be 4byte aligned
value
value to be ORed
return memory value | and value

Atomically XOR 32bit value with value in memory using amoxor.d.
addr
Address pointer to data, address need to be 4byte aligned
value
value to be XORed
return memory value ^ and value

Atomically unsigned max compare 32bit value with value in memory using amomaxu.d.
addr
Address pointer to data, address need to be 4byte aligned
value
value to be compared
return the bigger value

Atomically signed max compare 32bit value with value in memory using amomax.d.
addr
Address pointer to data, address need to be 4byte aligned
value
value to be compared
the bigger value

Atomically unsigned min compare 32bit value with value in memory using amominu.d.
addr
Address pointer to data, address need to be 4byte aligned
value
value to be compared
the smaller value

Atomically signed min compare 32bit value with value in memory using amomin.d.
addr
Address pointer to data, address need to be 4byte aligned
value
value to be compared
the smaller value

briefdescription.para: Base core feature API for Nuclei N/NX Core.
